page.title: 19BROADWAY FLOWER SHOW
page.content: {The Broadway Flower Show}is held annually in the Lifford Hall on the second Saturday in September. It was established in 1962. It offers an opportunity for local people to display their skills in gardening, flower arranging, cookery and handicrafts. There are 70-75 classes. Children can enter classes such as 'a miniature garden on a plate', collage, painting or simple cookery. Twenty trophies are awarded for merit in the different classes and are usually presented by a local personality. The Show is supported by local businesses and attracts a lot of interest in the village and surrounding area. At the end of the Show produce is auctioned to defray the cost of staging the event.
